page.title: 15BARNWELL PARK - TREES
page.content: The park is about 50% trees and other vegetation, and 50% water. Examples of the trees found there are white willow. oak and beech. The white willow is found next to the water. Some of the trees have fencing around them to protect them from animals chewing them. There is a lot of rough vegetation which is kept uncut so that insects and animals can hide and be in the shade. The grass is cut regularly on the meadows and on the paths by the warden, Neil Lister, although they sometimes get a bit muddy. A lot of the trees have nesting boxes in them which are numbered. There is also a tree planting programme eg.Watch Spinney on the west edge planted by the{Oundle}Watch Group in March 1983. Willow trees are also coppiced to form a screen around the lake and to hide the A605.
